za.co.neilson.sqlite.orm

Interface DatabaseDriverInterface<R,C>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the result collection returned by a query. Android Returns a Cursor Object whilst JDBC returns a ResultSet
    C - The type of the result collection returned by a query. The type of map used to map column names to column values. Android requires the use of a ContentValues object whilst JDBC simply uses a HashMap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JdbcSqliteDatabaseDriverInterface

    public interface DatabaseDriverInterface<R,C>

    The interface between the database driver and the DatabaseModel.

    The DatabaseDriverInterface class should never be instantiated directly. This is done via the DatabaseModel which holds an internal reference to the DatabaseDriverInterface

    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Sheldon Neilson

      • getFirstColumnIndex

        int getFirstColumnIndex()
        Returns the index of the first column of a database result returned by this driver. Android's SQLiteCursor column indexes are 0 based, JDBC's ResultSet column indexes start at 1
        Returns:
        int the index of the first column of a database result
        Since:
        0.1

      • execute

        boolean execute(java.lang.String sql)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given SQL statement and indicates the form of the first result.
        Parameters:
        sql - the sql statement to execute
        Returns:
        boolean true if the first result is a ResultSet object; false if it is an update count or there are no results
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • query

        R query(java.lang.String tableName,
      java.lang.String[] columnNames,
      java.lang.String whereClause,
      java.lang.Object[] whereArgs,
      java.lang.String groupBy,
      java.lang.String having,
      java.lang.String orderBy,
      java.lang.Integer limit)
        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Queries the given table using any non-null clauses, returning a single ResultSet object containing the results of the query.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table to query
        columnNames - the specific columns to return in the result set. If columNames is null, all columns will be returned.
        whereClause - The optional WHERE clause to apply to the query. Passing null will select all rows
        whereArgs - Question marks in the whereClause String will be replaced with these whereArgs in order. (where id = ?)
        groupBy - a comma delimited list of the column names to group the returned results by
        having -
        orderBy - a comma delimited list of the column names to order the returned results by
        limit - an optional numeric limit on the number of results returned
        Returns:
        ResultSet the results of the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • rawQuery

        R rawQuery(java.lang.String sql,
         java.lang.Object[] selectionArgs)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        sql - the sql query to execute
        selectionArgs - any ?s in the sql query will be replaced by the String representation of these selectionArgs in order
        Returns:
        ResultSet
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • update

        int update(java.lang.String tableName,
         C columnValues,
         java.lang.String whereClause,
         java.lang.Object[] whereArgs)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table to update
        columnValues -
        whereClause - The optional WHERE clause to apply when selecting the records to update. Passing null will select all rows
        whereArgs - Question marks in the whereClause String will be replaced with these whereArgs in order. (where id = ?)
        Returns:
        int the number of rows affected
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

      • delete

        int delete(java.lang.String tableName,
         java.lang.String whereClause,
         java.lang.Object[] whereArgs)
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table from which to delete records
        whereClause - The optional WHERE clause to apply when deleting. Passing null will delete all rows
        whereArgs - Question marks in the whereClause String will be replaced with these whereArgs in order. (where id = ?)
        Returns:
        int the number of rows affected by the query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        0.1

            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:
